com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map

Class MapCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map.MapCanvas
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MapDisplay.Layer, MapTexture

    public abstract class MapCanvas
extends java.lang.Object
    A base implementation canvas for performing drawing operations on. Implementations of this canvas should implement the following methods:
    • getWidth() - resolution width
    • getHeight() - resolution height
    • getBuffer() - read-only buffer for all canvas contents
    • readPixel(int, int) - read a single pixel
    • readPixels(int, int, int, int, byte[]) - read an area of pixels
    • writePixel(int, int, byte) - write a single pixel
    • writePixels(int, int, int, int, byte[]) - write an area of pixels
    • writePixelsFill(int, int, int, int, byte) - fill an area of pixels

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public abstract int getWidth()
        Gets the width of this canvas
        Returns:
        canvas width

      • getHeight

        public abstract int getHeight()
        Gets the height of this canvas
        Returns:
        canvas height

      • getBuffer

        public abstract byte[] getBuffer()
        Gets the backing color data buffer for all the data in this canvas. This buffer is not guaranteed to be immutable. For an immutable buffer, use readPixels() instead. This data is formatted in such a way that:
        • The first color in the array is pixel (0, 0)
        • Satisfies condition index = x + y * width
        • The size of the buffer equals (width * height)
        Returns:
        raw color byte buffer

      • readPixel

        public abstract byte readPixel(int x,
                               int y)
        Reads the pixel color value of a single pixel
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the pixel
        y - - coordinate of the pixel
        Returns:
        color at this pixel, 0 for transparent

      • writePixel

        public abstract void writePixel(int x,
                                int y,
                                byte color)
        Updates the pixel color of a single pixel. No color blending or depth buffering logic is performed.
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the pixel
        y - - coordinate of the pixel
        color - to draw

      • readPixels

        public byte[] readPixels(int x,
                         int y,
                         int w,
                         int h,
                         byte[] dst_buffer)
        Reads the raw pixel color data for a particular area in this canvas. This is guaranteed to be a copy of the actual data. This data is formatted in such a way that:
        • The first color in the array is pixel (0, 0)
        • Satisfies condition index = x + y * width
        • The size of the buffer equals (width * height)
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        y - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        w - - width of the area
        h - - height of the area
        dst_buffer - - buffer to write the pixels to
        Returns:
        dst_buffer input parameter

      • writePixels

        public MapCanvas writePixels(int x,
                             int y,
                             int w,
                             int h,
                             byte[] colorData)
        Writes raw pixel color data to a rectangular area in this canvas. No color blending is performed and any original pixels are replaced. No depth buffering is performed, either. This data must be formatted in such a way that:
        • The first color in the array is pixel (0, 0)
        • Satisfies condition index = x + y * width
        • The size of the buffer is at least (width * height)
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        y - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        w - - width of the area
        h - - height of the area
        colorData - to write

      • writePixelsFill

        public MapCanvas writePixelsFill(int x,
                                 int y,
                                 int w,
                                 int h,
                                 byte color)
        Fills a rectangular area in this canvas with a single color. No color blending is performed and any original pixels are replaced. No depth buffering is performed, either.
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        y - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        w - - width of the area
        h - - height of the area
        color - to fill
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • drawRawData

        public final MapCanvas drawRawData(int x,
                                   int y,
                                   int w,
                                   int h,
                                   byte[] colorData)
        Writes raw pixel color data to a rectangular area in this canvas. If a blend mode is set for this canvas, it is used to perform pixel color blending. This data must be formatted in such a way that:
        • The first color in the array is pixel (0, 0)
        • Satisfies condition index = x + y * width
        • The size of the buffer is at least (width * height)
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        y - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        w - - width of the area
        h - - height of the area
        colorData - to write

      • drawRawData

        public final MapCanvas drawRawData(int x,
                                   int y,
                                   int w,
                                   int h,
                                   byte[] colorData,
                                   byte colorFactor)
        Writes raw pixel color data to a rectangular area in this canvas. If a blend mode is set for this canvas, it is used to perform pixel color blending. If a depth value is set for this canvas, depth buffering logic will be performed on the data. A color factor can be specified; all the color data is multiplied with that factor. When null data is specified, the area is filled with the colorFactor color instead.

        The colorData buffer must be formatted such that:
        • The first color in the array is pixel (0, 0)
        • Satisfies condition index = x + y * width
        • The size of the buffer is at least (width * height)
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        y - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        w - - width of the area
        h - - height of the area
        colorData - to write, null to fill with the colorFactor color
        colorFactor - to apply, 0 for no factor

      • readPixels

        public final byte[] readPixels()
        Reads all the pixel color data in this canvas. This is guaranteed to be a copy of the actual data. This data is formatted in such a way that:
        • The first color in the array is pixel (0, 0)
        • Satisfies condition index = x + y * width
        • The size of the buffer equals (width * height)
        Returns:
        byte buffer containing the pixel color data in this canvas

      • readPixels

        public final byte[] readPixels(int x,
                               int y,
                               int w,
                               int h)
        Reads the raw pixel color data for a particular area in this canvas. This is guaranteed to be a copy of the actual data. This data is formatted in such a way that:
        • The first color in the array is pixel (0, 0)
        • Satisfies condition index = x + y * width
        • The size of the buffer equals (width * height)
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        y - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        w - - width of the area
        h - - height of the area
        Returns:
        byte buffer containing the pixel color data in the area

      • draw

        public final MapCanvas draw(MapCanvas canvas,
                            int x,
                            int y,
                            byte colorFactor)
        Draws the contents of another canvas or texture onto this canvas. If a blend mode is set for this canvas, it is used to perform pixel color blending. A color factor can be specified. All color data will be pre-multiplied with that factor.
        Parameters:
        canvas - with the pixel data to draw
        x - - position of the top-left corner of the sprite
        y - - position of the top-left corner of the sprite
        colorFactor - to use
        Returns:

      • remap

        public final MapCanvas remap(byte[] remappingColors)
        Converts all the pixel color data to remap to a new color format. The remappingColors array should at least have the size of the lowest color pixel value.
        Parameters:
        remappingColors - array containing the color remapping table
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • drawMove

        public final MapCanvas drawMove(MapCanvas canvas,
                                int old_x,
                                int old_y,
                                int new_x,
                                int new_y)
        Re-draws the contents of another canvas, clearing the old rectangular area. When sprites gradually move, this method can be used for optimized updates. This function always draws, even when the old and new positions are the same. If that is not desired, do a check up front.
        Parameters:
        canvas - with the pixel data to draw
        old_x - - old x-coordinate of the sprite
        old_y - - old y-coordinate of the sprite
        new_x - - new x-coordinate of the sprite
        new_y - - new y-coordinate of the sprite
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • movePixels

        public final MapCanvas movePixels(int dx,
                                  int dy)
        Moves all pixel information, including depth buffer data, with an offset. This enables quick movement of pixel data without re-drawing all the parts.
        Parameters:
        dx - pixel offset
        dy - pixel offset
        Returns:
        this canvas

        public final MapCanvas clear()

      • setLightOptions

        @Deprecated
public final MapCanvas setLightOptions(float ambientLightFactor,
                                                    float directionalLightFactor,
                                                    Vector3f directionVector)
        Deprecated. 

      • setLightOptions

        public final MapCanvas setLightOptions(float ambientLightFactor,
                                       float directionalLightFactor,
                                       Vector3 directionVector)
        Sets the ambient and directional light source options:
        • Ambient light is how lit the model is regardless of its orientation. This light level can be considered a baseline of minimal illumination. It is important to have some ambient light to avoid extremely dark surfaces.
        • Directional light is light that depends on the orientation of the model surface. When facing into the light direction, the light level is fully applied resulting in a lit surface. When facing away this light level is not applied, resulting in a dark surface. To display realistic-looking models, some directional light helps to distinguish different orientations.
        Parameters:
        ambientLightFactor - - amount of ambient light emitted
        directionalLightFactor - - amount of directional light emitted
        directionVector - - direction of the directional light
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • setBrushMask

        public final MapCanvas setBrushMask(MapCanvas mask)
        Sets a mask defining the pixels that are drawn. Non-transparent pixels in the mask will be drawn onto this canvas for all drawing operations. Transparent pixels in the mask will not be drawn at all, and also skip depth buffer tests and blend modes. It is recommended that the mask is the same size as this canvas, since the mask is applied relative to (0, 0).
        Parameters:
        mask - to apply, null to disable the mask
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • setRelativeBrushMask

        public final MapCanvas setRelativeBrushMask(MapCanvas mask)
        Sets a mask defining the draw-relative pixels that are drawn. Non-transparent pixels in the mask will be drawn onto this canvas for all drawing operations. Transparent pixels in the mask will not be drawn at all, and also skip depth buffer tests and blend modes.
        Parameters:
        mask - to apply, null to disable the mask
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • clearDepthBuffer

        public final MapCanvas clearDepthBuffer()
        Clears the draw depth buffer, causing any previous contents to be erased when drawing in those areas.
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • clearDepthBuffer

        public final MapCanvas clearDepthBuffer(int x,
                                        int y,
                                        int width,
                                        int height)
        Clears the draw depth buffer in a rectangular area, causing any previous contents to be erased when drawing in those areas.
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the top-left point of the rectangle
        y - - coordinate of the top-left point of the rectangle
        width - of the rectangle
        height - of the rectangle
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • setDrawDepth

        public final MapCanvas setDrawDepth(int depth)
        Sets a depth value that will be used when performing the following drawing operations. The depth buffer will allow for different drawn areas to overlap each other correctly in the third dimension (z).

        Higher depth values correspond to contents 'deeper' into this canvas. In other words, as depth increases, objects are further away.

        When clearing areas, be aware that the contents behind it have to be re-drawn. Every call to setDrawDepth(int) will reset hasMoreDepth(), which allows you to check after drawing is completed whether deeper areas need to be re-drawn.
        Parameters:
        depth - to set to
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • hasMoreDepth

        public final boolean hasMoreDepth()
        Gets whether the previous drawing operations resulted in holes in the depth buffer, requiring deeper layers to be re-drawn.
        Returns:
        True if deeper areas need to be re-drawn as a result of previous drawing operations

      • getDepth

        public final int getDepth(int x,
                          int y)
        Gets the depth of a pixel drawn on this canvas with the depthbuffer enabled. Returns MAX_DEPTH when the pixel has no contents drawn there.
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the pixel
        y - - coordinate of the pixel
        Returns:
        depth of the pixel

      • getDepthBuffer

        public final short[] getDepthBuffer()
        Gets the mutable depth buffer of this canvas. The depth buffer dictates the depth value of every drawn pixel. If no depth buffer was used so far, this function returns null. This depth buffer data is formatted in such a way that:
        • The first depth value in the array is pixel (0, 0)
        • Satisfies condition index = x + y * width
        • The size of the buffer equals (width * height)
        Returns:
        depth buffer

      • hasMoreDepth

        public final boolean hasMoreDepth(int x,
                                  int y,
                                  int width,
                                  int height)
        Checks whether a rectangular area on this canvas has depth holes. A depth hole is where the depth is MAX_DEPTH, in other words, nothing is drawn.
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the rectangular area to check
        y - - coordinate of the rectangular area to check
        width - of the rectangular area to check
        height - of the rectangular area to check
        Returns:
        True if the area has depth holes

      • setSpacing

        public final MapCanvas setSpacing(int spacing)
        Sets the amount of pixels between each drawn character of a font. By default a spacing of 0 is used. Text fonts will have a default spacing set. Negative values are allowed to make spacing smaller.
        Parameters:
        spacing - to use, 0 for none
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • setAlignment

        public final MapCanvas setAlignment(MapFont.Alignment alignment)
        Sets the alignment at which font is drawn on this canvas. By default it is set to LEFT.
        • LEFT - Draws from left to right. x/y specify left/middle
        • RIGHT - Draws from right to left. x/y specify right/middle
        • MIDDLE - Draws the contents centered. x/y specify middle/middle
        Parameters:
        alignment - to set
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • getAlignment

        public final MapFont.Alignment getAlignment()
        Gets the alignment at which font is drawn on this canvas.
        Returns:
        font alignment

      • setBlendMode

        public final MapCanvas setBlendMode(MapBlendMode blendMode)
        Sets the color blending mode to use, applied when drawing contents on this canvas.
        • NONE - overwrites pixels already there, no transparency
        • OVERLAY - overwrites pixels with opaque pixels, transparent pixels do nothing
        • AVERAGE - takes the color average of the current pixels and the pixels drawn
        • ADD - adds the color values of the pixels drawn to the current pixels
        • SUBTRACT - subtracts the color values of the pixels drawn from the current pixels
        • MULTIPLY - multiplies the color values of the pixels drawn with the current pixels
        Parameters:
        blendMode -
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • getBlendMode

        public final MapBlendMode getBlendMode()
        Gets the color blending mode currently in use by this canvas. See also: setBlendMode(MapBlendMode)
        Returns:
        color blending mode

      • drawRectangle

                                         int y,
                                         int width,
                                         int height,
                                         byte color)
        Draws a rectangle
        Parameters:

        y - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle
        width - of the rectangle
        height - of the rectangle
        color - to draw the rectangle as
        Returns:

      • drawPixel

        public final MapCanvas drawPixel(int x,
                                 int y,
                                 byte color)
        Draws a single pixel color onto this canvas. Color blending logic is performed for this call.
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the pixel
        y - - coordinate of the pixel
        color - to draw

        @SafeVarargs
public final <T> MapCanvas draw(MapFont<T> font,
                                              int x,
                                              int y,
                                              T... characters)

        Parameters:

        x - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the first character drawn
        y - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the first character drawn
        characters - to draw
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • draw

        public final MapCanvas draw(MapFont<java.lang.Character> font,
                            int x,
                            int y,
                            byte color,
                            java.lang.CharSequence characters)
        Draws a text-based Character font using a solid color. If the font is a binary font, the color or transparent is drawn. For multicolor fonts, the color will be used as a multiplier.
        Parameters:
        font - to draw
        x - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the first character drawn
        y - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the first character drawn
        color - - color text
        characters - to draw
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • draw

        public final <T> MapCanvas draw(MapFont<T> font,
                                int x,
                                int y,
                                byte color,
                                java.lang.Iterable<T> characters)
        Draws a series of character sprites using a font and color. A transparent color will result in no color being applied to the font. For text fonts, this will result in white text. For colorful fonts, the colors will be preserved.
        Parameters:
        font - to draw
        x - - coordinate to start drawing
        y - - coordinate to start drawing
        color - - color to use when drawing the font
        characters - to draw
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • clone

        public final MapTexture clone()
        Creates a new MapTexture with a copy of the pixel data on this canvas. Changes drawn on the texture do not reflect back on this canvas.
        Overrides:

        Returns:
